title: What does an esoteric text say about male orgasm and magical transformation of female fluids?
first_phrase: In this part, the text delves into the topic of magic and the use of fire against nature to achieve transformation. It discusses the role of masculine energy in the process and the importance of the "amalgamation of the self with the enchanting and dissolving feminine fluid." The text refers to Alezareph, an Kabbalistic text, to symbolize this union, and to the Hathayogapradipik to emphasize the importance of the retention of virile energy for spiritual ascent. The Nabindu-Upanishad is also mentioned as a practice that allows one to overcome the "death" associated with female energy.
content: TI termine sanscrito spesso usato per il seme virile è virya, che però designa anche ciò che « Abraxa » ha chiamato la « virilità magica »: agisce nelle ascesi realizzatrici, perdendo però questa sua qualità quando si traduce nel seme emesso per la generazione animale. last_phrase: In conclusion, the Sanskrit term "virya" signifies both the magical virility and the seminal fluid. According to the Nabindu Upanishad, practicing the khecari mudra allows one to overcome the death-like influence of women on men. Understanding the symbolism involved in alchemical operations and knowing the point of inversion can help you control your vital energy and avoid wasting it.
